Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Initial Appearance as to Luis R. Cordero-Cruz held on 3/28/2012. AUSA Brian Kidd and AUSA Sean Torriente were present. Defendant was interviewed by the Probation Officer and was brought before the Magistrate Judge, was advised of rights and provided with copy of the indictment. Financial Affidavit was issued and approved. By Order of the Court, CJA counsel Richard Dansoh is directly appointed to represent defendant. Defendant was committed. The Government requested to unseal the case. The Court granted the request and ordered the unsealing of the case. Arraignment/Detention Hearings set for 4/2/2012 09:00 AM in Courtroom 8 before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll. (br) (Entered: 04/05/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Bail Hearing as to Angel D. Ramos-Cruz (26) was held on 1/2/2013. Present: SAUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty Anita Hill. Deft was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Superseding Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions.Case is referred to Judge Jose A. Fuste for trial setting. Defense counsel informed the Court that she also represents Deft 7 in this case. A Foster Hearing is set for 1/4/2013 at 10:30 AM in Courtroom 9 before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. As to bail, defense counsel informed that they had nothing to offer. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. AUSA Carmen Marquez and defense counsel Rafael Castro-Lang were present. Defendant was present in court and under custody. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant was found competent to plea. The Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count Six (6) of the Superseding Indictment. At the time of sentencing, the Government will request the dismissal of the remaining counts in this case and the dismissal of Criminal Cases 11- 388 (ADC) and 12-200 (JAF). The defendant is to remain under custody. The Court ordered the preparation of a presentence report. A report and recommendation will be issued. Minute for proceedings held before Judge Jose A Fuste: Sentencing held on 1/18/2013 for Miguel Feliciano-Boria (28). Present: SAUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty. Jose Romo- Matienzo, USPO Deni Rodriguez. Defendant is U/C and present in court. Defendant's criminal history was discussed. Defendant filed a 491 Motion to Dismiss the Indictment. Colloquy held between the Court and the Defendant re Pro se motion filed. After hearing the parties, the Court entered some findings on the record and denied 491 Motion to Dismiss Indictment. Defendant's allocution heard. The Court imposed a variance based on defendant's request that the sentence be imposed under CHC II. Counts 1, 2, 2s, 3, 3s, Dismissed; Count 1s, IMPR for 151 months; SRT of 5 years; SMA of $100.00. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)(Court Interpreter Mary Jo Smith.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 09:55.Hearing ended at 10:42. (dv) (Entered: 01/24/2013)

Ramirez-Rivera, Mike Graciani-Febus, Jose Laureano-Salgado, Antonio Perez-Medina re 548 MOTION Requesting Order. Designations of evidence and their sufficiency are governed by First Circuit case law and Rule 12. Any deficient designation carries a potential sanction of exclusion. At this stage, it is up to the government to fine tune its designation of evidence if needed or face the consequences of technical "non-designation." Be guided accordingly. Signed by Judge Jose A Fuste on 1/22/2013.(mrj) (Entered: 01/22/2013)

ORDER as to Luis Joel Rosario-Santiago, Carlos H. O'Neill-Serrano re 549 MOTION Requesting Order. Any use of a statement that involves a Bruton issue requires proper statement sanitation. Judge Smith will be the final arbiter of any such issue when framed in the context of the developed evidence at the time that the statement is offered. The court does not have access to any specific factual context at this time. Therefore, Judge Smith will decide those issues as they develop at trial, not pre-trial. Signed by Judge Jose A Fuste on 1/22/2013.(mrj) (Entered: 01/22/2013)

ORDER as to Mike Graciani-Febus re 553 MOTION to Suppress filed by Mike Graciani-Febus. The court points to the Supreme Court ruling in Simmons v. United States, 390 U.S. 377, 394 (1968), where the Court decided that when a defendant testifies in support of a motion to suppress evidence on Fourth-Amendment grounds, his testimony may not thereafter be admitted against him at trial on the issue of guilt unless he makes no objection. The proposal of submitting the defendant's testimony by way of affidavit without the government's right to cross-examination seems to have no support in the law. Signed by Judge Jose A Fuste on 1/22/2013.(mrj) (Entered: 01/22/2013)

ORDER re 584 Motion to Quash as to Mike Graciani-Febus (14). The position taken by the government is correct even if we concede that the defendant has satisfied indigency when he was granted CJA benefits. One of the subpoenas is addressed to John Doe. Fictionary (named witness) cannot be effectively subpoenaed. FBI agents must be subpoenaed following specific procedures in law. This is not the case here. Service of subpoenas must be done according to Rule 17, not as executed here. However, in the interest of Justice, the witnesses that are voluntary present today, or the witnesses that the government brought for the hearing may be called to testify even if the subpoena is not valid. Issues supplemented on the record during the suppression hearing. Signed by Judge Jose A Fuste on 01/25/2013. (dv) (Entered: 01/25/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge William E. Smith: Defendants Meeting as to Ismael E. Cruz-Ramos held on 2/6/2013. Present: AUSA Jenifer Hernandez and defense counsel Francisco Adams. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jose A Fuste: Sentencing held on 5/21/2013 for Mike Graciani-Febus (14). Objections to the PSR were discussed. Changes previously discussed with USPO and agreed upon shall be included in the PSR. The Court indicated that the objections were a late filing. At the time of sentencing, the Court took into consideration defendant's criminal history, and his participation in the conspiracy. ORDER re 1146 Motion to Continue as to Ismael E. Cruz-Ramos (9); 1137 Motion Requesting Order as to Pedro L. Ramirez-Rivera (13); 1145 Motion to Continue as to Pedro L. Ramirez-Rivera (13); 1143 Motion to Continue as to Jose Laureano-Salgado (15). Judge Fuste and Judge Smith have conferred on this motions and agree that the sentencing hearings of these three defendants should be handled by the presiding trial judge, Judge Smith. Therefore the sentencing previously set by Judge Fuste are vacated . The sentencing hearings will be continued to a future date to be determined by Judge Smith. Judge Smith will attempt to schedule the hearings for the requested dates in the beginning of October, subject to his trial schedule. With this in mind, Objections to the PSR shall be filed by September 20, and responses by the 27th. Signed by Judge William E. Smith on 08/30/2013. (dv) (Entered: 08/30/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge William E. Smith: Sentencing held on 10/2/2013 for Pedro L. Ramirez-Rivera (13). Present: AUSA Jenifer Hernandez, SAUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty. Miguel Oppenheimer, USPO Silvia Ortiz. Defendant is U/C and present in court. PSR to be amended to correct the guideline calculation as to Cts. 1, 2 and 3. Defendant's objections to the PSR were overruled. The Court granted Atty. Oppenheimer's request to adopt the arguments presented during the sentencing hearings of Defendants #9 and #15. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Government requested the maximum penalties as to each count. Counts 1, 2, 3, 34, 35, Dismissed; Counts 1s, 29s, 2s, 30s, 3s - IMPR for 40 yrs. as to Ct. 1s, 20 yrs as to Ct. 2s, 20 yrs as to Ct. 3s, and LIFE as to Ct. 29s, all terms to be served concurrently with each other, AND 25 yrs as to Ct. 30s to be served consecutively; SRT of 10 yrs; SMA of $500.00. Defendant was advised of his right to appeal. (Court Reporter Evilys Brathwaite.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 02:34.Hearing ended at 03:14. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (dv) (Entered: 10/03/2013)

ORDER denying 1255 Motion for Reconsideration as to Edwin Bernard Astacio-Espino (2)These defendants and the violent acts thet allegedly engaged in, coupled with the boldness of the antisocial conduct described in the indictement merit an annonymous jury. Tha fact that in the previous phase nothing happened with an annonymous jury in place, is evidence that the precaution had its effect. It would be irresponsible for a federal judge not to take any and all precautions to safeguard jury integrity. Voir dire was ample and complete,and was done without objection as to content.; holding in abeyance 1274 I am holding this motion in abeyance pending determination of availability of funds and also in light of the moneys already spent for the benefit of this defendant. There are transcripts available from the previous trial. Motion Requesting Order as to Edwin Bernard Astacio-Espino (2); granting in part and denying in part for the same reasons as in 1274. 1275 Motion Requesting Order as to Edwin Bernard Astacio-Espino (2); granting 1276 Motion to Restrict as to Edwin Bernard Astacio- Espino (2)Signed by Judge Jose A. MEMORANDUM as to Edwin Bernard Astacio-Espino Last Friday Nov 1,we agreed that certain recordings of conversations by cooperating witnesses out of the MDC telephone system could be reviewed by counsel subject to a protective order. A paralegal was to do this job after visiting the Court and being instructed accordingly. Counsel left on the evening of Nov | without accomplishing the above. We also note that available records on inmate misconduct at MDC Guaynabo were available to defense counsel but were never requested for cross examination. Lastly, we have offered defendant Bernard a hearing on his motion to suppress limited to the issue of standing. We cannot consider a tailor made affidavit of a codefendant who pled for harboring Bernard as a fugitive without cross examination. As of today, we have not received a statement that witnesses are available to testify on the issue of standing. Signed by Judge Jose A. Fuste on 11/3/2013.(Fuste, Jose) Modified on 11/5/2013 to edit text as per chambers request(ab). (Entered: 11/03/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge William E. Smith (by telephone conference): Status Conference as to Ismael E. Cruz-Ramos (9) held on 9/3/2015 re 1676 Judgment of USCA. Present: AUSA Victor Acevedo, AUSA Jenifer Hernandez (arrived @ 11:00 AM), Defense Counsel Francisco Adams. Government indicated that they will request an en banc hearing before the Court of Appeals. Petition will be submitted during the beginning of next month. As to the COA's Opinion regarding the suppression issue, the government will present one additional witness, if necessary. No counts will be dismissed. Defendant must be transferred to MDC Guaynabo. Writ to be issued. If en banc petition is denied, defendant's motion to suppress shall be re-filed once the Mandate of USCA is filed. Jury Trial will be set for Jan or Feb 2016. Further Status Conference set for 10/29/2015 10:00 AM in Courtroom 7 before Judge William E. Smith. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 11:00.Hearing held at 10:58.Hearing ended at 11:22. Present: AUSA Jenifer Hernandez, AUSA Victor Acevedo-Hernandez and Attorney Francisco Adams-Quesada. The "Motion for Exculpatory Material and/or Material Sufficient to Create a Reasonable Doubt at docket 1743 was discussed. The Court grants in part Defendants Motion for Exculpatory Material and/or Material Sufficient to Create a Reasonable Doubt 1743 as to Ismael E. Cruz-Ramos(9). The Government is ordered to review all material relating to the investigation of the murder of Christian Toledo Sanchez, A.K.A. Pekeke, including but not limited to this matter as well as the CR No. 15-462 (JAF), to determine whether or not there is any exculpatory information for Defendant, and to produce any such information to Defendant. The Court reserves ruling on Defendants request with respect to information concerning Agent Luis Flores Ortiz. The parties are ordered to submit supplemental briefs regarding Defendants motion to suppress statements. Defendant will renew his motion by January 29, 2016, and the Government will respond by February 16, 2016. Defendant should explain in detail in this brief the connection between Agent Flores Ortiz and Defendants suppression argument in order to support his request for Giglio materials.Signed by Judge William E. Smith on 1/8/2016. (cc) (Entered: 01/11/2016)

ORDER as to Roberto L. Aponte-Cordero (23): Defendant has moved the court to grant him sentencing relief under Amendment 782 to the Sentencing Guidelines. (ECF No. 1579 .) The court initially denied him relief at ECF No. 1700 , but we have now reconsidered our decision. At the moment, however, the court lacks authority to grant defendant relief because an appeal of his judgment of conviction has been docketed and is pending. Accordingly, under Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 12.1(a), the court hereby indicates to the Court of Appeals that we would grant defendant the requested sentencing relief if the case were remanded to us. Signed by Judge Jose A. Fuste on 2/8/2016.(mrj) (Entered: 02/08/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge William E. Smith:Status Conference as to Ismael E. Cruz-Ramos (9) held on 3/23/2016. Present: AUSA Jenifer Hernandez- Vega, AUSA Victor Acevedo-Hernandez and Attorney Francisco Adams-Quesada. AUSA Hernandez-Vega informed the Court that defendant Victor Santana-Gonzalez was arrested a month ago. She added that discovery and a plea offer were tendered to defendants Cruz-Ramos (9) and Santana-Gonzalez (5) and that the Government is ready for trial. The Court shall speak to Judge Fuste and determine whether to keep the case or transfer it. Attorney Adams-Quesada stated that a new plea offer was received from the Government. Additionally, he has been in communication with AUSA Acevedo- Hernandez as to a possible plea agreement. AUSA Acevedo-Hernandez said that the defendant has until 4/11/2016 to accept the final plea offer. Parties discussed the motion at docket 1773, Motion Requesting Order to Produce Rough Notes; the Court did not pass a ruling at during the Status Conference. Attorney Adams-Quesada will file a motion to continue in order for him to finalize plea negotiations and review the discovery with his client. Status Conference set for 4/5/2016 03:00 PM before Judge William E. Smith. Courtroom to be assigned on a later date based on availability. STA tolled until the next conference in the interest of justice. The Court finds that the defendants need to review evidence and conduct negotiations outweighs the defendants and the community's interest in a speedy trial.(Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.)Hearing set for 02:00.Hearing held at 02:04.Hearing ended at 03:08. (cc) (Entered: 03/28/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Bail as to Victor Santana-Gonzalez (5) on Counts 1s,2s,3s,13s,14s,15s,16s,29s,30s held on 3/31/2016. Present: AUSA Jenifer Hernandez, Atty. Juan Matos and PO Emanuel Bravo. Defendant was present in court and assisted by court interpreter Mary Jo Smith. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and  entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. Unless there is an order or directive from the presiding US District Judge indicating otherwise, the government shall have 7 days to produce discovery and the defense 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Fuste for further proceedings. As to bail, the government requested detention. Defense counsel informed that at this moment he had no evidence to rebut the presumption, but requested bail because of defendant's health condition. The Court ordered defendant detained on the basis of risk of flight and danger to the community. Also, the Court ordered the preparation of a second notice to MDC. Defense counsel informed the court that he had been representing defendant Jean Carlos Ramos-Pineiro (1) in this case but that proceeding is over, and he has been retained by defendant Victor Santana-Gonzalez (5) and there is no conflict of interest in representing defendant Victor Santana-Gonzalez (5) at this time. The government informed that there is no conflict at this time. The Court noted the request. (Court Reporter DCR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:00.Hearing ended at 02:30. (ft) Modified on 4/5/2016 to edit docket text. (ft). (Entered: 04/05/2016)

ORDER as to Ismael E. Cruz-Ramos (9): Defendants Motion for Continuance to the JULY 2016 Trial Calendar is GRANTED.The matter is continued until an empanelment to be scheduled sometime after July 15th, 2016. The time included from the filing of this 1793 Motion through disposition, as well as the duration of the continuance, constitutes excludable time as defined by 18 U.S.C. §3161 (F). Such period is deemed excludable, for the reasons stated above, and because the interest of justice in allowing the defendant to fully understand his constitutional rights regarding the criminal charges pending against him outweighs the interest of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial. Signed by Judge William E. Smith on 4/20/2016.(sc) (Entered: 04/25/2016)

ORDER temporarily denying 1775 Motion to Appoint Counsel as to Jose Abel Ramos- Cruz (7). The appointment-of-counsel analysis is different depending on the procedural remedy being sought. Thus, as Defendant has not specified what procedural remedy he requests an attorney for, the Court is forced to deny the motion without prejudice. It would appear that Defendant requests that the Court appoint him an attorney to handle his motion under 28 U.S.C. § 2255. If this is so, Defendant must file a motion to appoint counsel under the proper case number: 16-cv-1325 (DRD). Signed by Judge Daniel R. Dominguez on 5/11/2016. (MF) (Entered: 05/11/2016)

USCA JUDGMENT as to Carlos H. O'Neill-Serrano (11) entered on 07/12/16; Citing Johnson v. United States, 135 S. Ct. 2551 (2015) and other cases, petitioner has filed an application for leave to file a second or successive motion under 28 U.S.C. § 2255. There is no indication, however, that petitioner has yet filed a first § 2255 motion. Consequently, petitioner does not need authorization from this court to proceed in the district court with a § 2255 motion. The clerk of court will transfer petitioner's filings to the district court for filing as a § 2255 motion. The motion shall be deemed filed in the district court on June 27, 2016, the date it was received and docketed by the court of appeals. (Attachments: # 1 Exhibit 2255 Petition) (xi) (Entered: 07/12/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge William E. Smith:Change of Plea Hearing as to Victor Santana-Gonzalez (5) held on 10/20/2016. Present: AUSA Marie Christine Amy, AUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty. Todd Merer and Atty. Juan Matos-De Juan. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. Plea entered by Victor Santana-Gonzalez (5) Guilty Count 1s. After reviewing the PSR, the Court will decide if this Type C Agreement is accepted. Sentencing Memorandum due by 1/31/2017. Sentencing Hearing set for 2/16/2017 09:30 AM in Courtroom 5 before Judge William E. Smith. PSI Report ordered. E-mail sent to USPO. Defense counsel requested an order from the Court to obtain defendant's medical records. The Court granted the request. Proposed Order to be submitted. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 09:59.Hearing ended at 10:31.Interpreter Mary Jo Smith / Enith Valdes. (dv) (Entered: 10/20/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge William E. Smith: Motion Hearing as to Ismael E. Cruz-Ramos (9) held on 10/20/2016 re 1889 MOTION for Hearing filed by Ismael E. Cruz-Ramos. Present: AUSA Marie Christine Amy, AUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty. Francisco Adams. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Government stated that the offer extended to the defendant was a final offer. Defendant was explained the consequences of a conviction and the evidence against him. After hearing the government, defendant indicated that he is aware of the plea offer and decided to reject it. Trial is set for December 2016. Atty. Adams requested a continuance of the trial date. Matter taken under advisement. ETD - 1 week. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:32.Hearing ended at 11:10.Interpreter Enith Valdes / Mary Jo Smith. (dv) (Entered: 10/27/2016)
